@punkrocksellout Find yourself a cheaper firm option then.
@punkrocksellout Now that's a good choice.
@punkrocksellout I'm in favour of a loveseat, but one with firmer cushions people don't sink into.
@punkrocksellout I do not like that feeling in offices. I want to feel composed and in control, and that chair takes that away for me.
@punkrocksellout It looks too comfy which means I'd feel uncomfortable while waiting in it. Love it in a home though.

@nielsvaneekelen @thewrongkeys I think the bigger risk is waiting for them to be burnt out, and then giving them an event.
@nielsvaneekelen @thewrongkeys They gave Hopeless Greg Land to boost Spider-Woman. They like their internal narratives.
@nielsvaneekelen @thewrongkeys Which this is.
@thewrongkeys @nielsvaneekelen Okay, but given that Marvel will put out events anyway...
@thewrongkeys @nielsvaneekelen Come on. You're telling me after Ultimates, you don't want to see him on an event?
@thewrongkeys @nielsvaneekelen Not a great book for him to be on, but it'll sell well, and hopefully justify him getting a big event.

@Snarkosa Right, and I disagree with that. I think outright opposition is better. But that's not the same as 'give him a chance'.
@Snarkosa He's saying that the only option he sees is to work with Trump rather than against him. I disagree with him, but that's different.
@Snarkosa I'm not saying he's the hero here, but he's not saying to embrace Trump, nor to give Trump a chance.
@Snarkosa I don't think he made that conclusion though. The article doesn't pull that from a direct quote.
@Snarkosa It's a pretty big mischaracterization of what he actually said.

@jpooch21 @Like_car_Keys Remember when Disney bought CrossGen? Good times.
@scottberry @VaGentlenerd @mr_oberts Which makes me glad we live in an era of leaks.
@VaGentlenerd @mr_oberts @scottberry At this point, there really need to be photos posted. You agree with that, right?
@Like_car_Keys @jpooch21 Right, but it's enough to demonstrate Nintendo isn't the company to buy for gaming strategies.
@jpooch21 @Like_car_Keys Definitely. I just don't see Disney as the right partner here, and think the IP is less valuable that most think.
@jpooch21 @Like_car_Keys I'd rather see Nickelodeon buy the TV and movie rights.
@jpooch21 @Like_car_Keys Considering Mario run did under $60 million though, it just doesn't seem like a valuable property on Disney terms.
@jpooch21 @Like_car_Keys I'm sure Disney could make it work. I just don't see the synergy that made the Marvel deal so good.
